Figure 2 shows the profit/loss diagram for the buyer (long) and seller (short) of the put
option that we have been discussing. This profit/loss diagram illustrates that:
The maximum loss for the buyer of a put is the loss of the $5 premium
(at any S> $50).
The maximum gain to the buyer of a put is limited to the strike price less the
premium ($50 – $5 = $45). The potential loss to the writer of the put is the same
